meanings.sent1: The garblers in the office always spread rumors.
meanings.sent2: The detective caught the garblers who were spreading false news.
meanings.sent3: The garblers at the party made up silly stories for fun.
meanings.sent4: The garblers of the town twisted the truth like a tangled thread.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the garblers who twist facts to suit their agenda.

meanings.definition: To mix up or distort information.
meanings.sent1: Please don't garblers the facts when you report the news.
meanings.sent2: He garblers the instructions and ended up lost in the city.
meanings.sent3: The comedian garblers his jokes to make them even funnier.
meanings.sent4: Her words garblers the truth like a broken telephone game.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes garblers the colors into a beautiful mess.

meanings.sent1: The garblers of the story confused everyone at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The garblers of the data led to a lot of misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The garblers of the play made the audience laugh at the mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: The garblers of the news painted a distorted picture of reality.
meanings.sent5: The garblers of history twisted the past into a tangled web.
